intro: Rhexia hexandra, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swampy areas. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture. Rhexia hexandra is also notable for its underground tubers, which give it the common name "pinkroot."
